verses.kjv: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Moses and said,

verses.kjv: Speak unto Aaron, and unto his sons, and unto all the children of Israel, and say unto them; This is the thing which the LORD hath commanded, saying,
verses.ct: "Give these instructions to Aaron, his sons, and all the people of Israel. This is what the LORD has commanded:

verses.kjv: What man soever there be of the house of Israel, that killeth an ox, or lamb, or goat, in the camp, or that killeth it out of the camp,
verses.ct: Any Israelite who slaughters a bull, a lamb, or a goat — whether inside the camp or outside it —

verses.kjv: And bringeth it not unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, to offer an offering unto the LORD before the tabernacle of the LORD; blood shall be imputed unto that man; he hath shed blood; and that man shall be cut off from among his people:
verses.ct: and does not bring it to the entrance of the tent of meeting to present it as an offering to the LORD in front of his tabernacle, that person will be held guilty of bloodshed. Because he has shed blood, that person must be expelled from his people.

verses.kjv: To the end that the children of Israel may bring their sacrifices, which they offer in the open field, even that they may bring them unto the LORD, unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, unto the priest, and offer them for peace offerings unto the LORD.
verses.ct: The purpose of this rule is so that the Israelites will bring the sacrifices they have been making out in the open fields to the LORD instead — bringing them to the entrance of the tent of meeting, to the priest, and presenting them as peace offerings to the LORD.

verses.kjv: And the priest shall sprinkle the blood upon the altar of the LORD at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, and burn the fat for a sweet savour unto the LORD.
verses.ct: The priest will then splash the blood against the altar of the LORD at the entrance of the tent of meeting and burn the fat as a pleasing aroma to the LORD.

verses.kjv: And they shall no more offer their sacrifices unto devils, after whom they have gone a whoring. This shall be a statute for ever unto them throughout their generations.
verses.ct: They must never again offer their sacrifices to demons, which they have been unfaithfully chasing after. This is a permanent regulation for them across all their generations."

verses.kjv: And thou shalt say unto them, Whatsoever man there be of the house of Israel, or of the strangers which sojourn among you, that offereth a burnt offering or sacrifice,
verses.ct: "Also tell them: Any Israelite or any foreigner living among you who presents a burnt offering or any other sacrifice

verses.kjv: And bringeth it not unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, to offer it unto the LORD; even that man shall be cut off from among his people.
verses.ct: but does not bring it to the entrance of the tent of meeting to offer it to the LORD — that person must be expelled from his people.

verses.kjv: And whatsoever man there be of the house of Israel, or of the strangers that sojourn among you, that eateth any manner of blood; I will even set my face against that soul that eateth blood, and will cut him off from among his people.
verses.ct: If any Israelite or any foreigner living among you consumes any kind of blood, I will turn against that person who eats blood and will expel him from his people.

verses.kjv: For the life of the flesh is in the blood: and I have given it to you upon the altar to make an atonement for your souls: for it is the blood that maketh an atonement for the soul.
verses.ct: Because the life of a creature is in its blood, and I have assigned it to you for use on the altar to make atonement for your souls. It is the blood that makes atonement for the soul.

verses.kjv: Therefore I said unto the children of Israel, No soul of you shall eat blood, neither shall any stranger that sojourneth among you eat blood.
verses.ct: That is why I have told the people of Israel: None of you may consume blood, and no foreigner living among you may consume blood either.

verses.kjv: And whatsoever man there be of the children of Israel, or of the strangers that sojourn among you, which hunteth and catcheth any beast or fowl that may be eaten; he shall even pour out the blood thereof, and cover it with dust.
verses.ct: Any Israelite or foreigner living among you who hunts and catches a wild animal or bird that is permitted for eating must drain out its blood and cover it with dirt.

verses.kjv: For it is the life of all flesh; the blood of it is for the life thereof: therefore I said unto the children of Israel, Ye shall eat the blood of no manner of flesh: for the life of all flesh is the blood thereof: whosoever eateth it shall be cut off.
verses.ct: Because the life of every creature is its blood — its blood is its life. That is why I told the people of Israel: You must not consume the blood of any creature, because the life of every creature is its blood. Whoever consumes it must be expelled.

verses.kjv: And every soul that eateth that which died of itself, or that which was torn with beasts, whether it be one of your own country, or a stranger, he shall both wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even: then shall he be clean.
verses.ct: Anyone — whether a native Israelite or a foreigner — who eats an animal that died naturally or was killed by wild animals must wash their clothes, bathe in water, and remain unclean until evening. After that, they will be clean.

verses.kjv: But if he wash them not, nor bathe his flesh; then he shall bear his iniquity.
verses.ct: But if they do not wash their clothes and bathe, they will bear the consequences of their sin."
